title: How we restructured Airtable's entire org for AI | Howie Liu (co-founder and CEO)
key_insights: CEOs should become individual contributors again in the AI era to understand capabilities and make better product decisions
Restructure teams into fast thinking (weekly AI shipping) and slow thinking (deliberate infrastructure) groups
Everyone on product teams needs to develop hybrid skills across PM, engineering, and design
Use AI tools extensively yourself before expecting teams to adopt them effectively
Start with experimentation and vibes before creating formal evals for AI products
Break down role silos and encourage full stack thinking across all functions
Constantly ask if you were starting today, what would you build differently
Create urgency around AI adoption by matching the pace of AI native companies

memorable_quotes: If you were literally founding a new company from scratch with the same mission, how would you execute on that mission using a fully AI native approach?
I take pride in being the number one most expensive in inference cost user of Airtable AI

summary: Howie Liu shares how Airtable restructured its entire organization for the AI era, emphasizing the need for CEOs to become hands-on builders again and for all team members to develop hybrid skills across product, engineering, and design. He provides tactical advice on creating fast-moving AI teams while maintaining deliberate infrastructure work.
